snippet: The world’s largest steel maker felt the effects of a sharp fall in iron ore prices, and its rival ThyssenKrupp posted a modest profit.
abstract: ArcelorMittal reports fourth-quarter loss of $955 million, as well as 5 percent decline in earnings to $1.8 billion, underscoring slumping steel and iron ore market; at same time,ThyssenKrupp reports profit of 43 million euros, or about $48.8 million, for same quarter.
lead_paragraph: The world’s largest steel maker felt the effects of a sharp fall in iron ore prices, and its rival ThyssenKrupp posted a modest profit.

headline.main: ArcelorMittal Reports $955 Million Loss; ThyssenKrupp Ekes Out a Small Profit
headline.print_headline: ArcelorMittal Reports $955 Million Loss; ThyssenKrupp Ekes Out a Small Profit
